summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
Specifies values for the structure. These values describe the properties of media samples.

member.name: tagAM_SAMPLE_PROPERTY_FLAGS.AM_SAMPLE_SPLICEPOINT
member.summary: Sample is a splice point (it can be decoded without reference to previous data).

member.name: tagAM_SAMPLE_PROPERTY_FLAGS.AM_SAMPLE_DATADISCONTINUITY
member.summary: Initial data in this sample is a splice point. The data in the previous sample was not intended to be followed by data in this sample. For more information, see Remarks.

member.name: tagAM_SAMPLE_PROPERTY_FLAGS.AM_SAMPLE_TIMEDISCONTINUITY
member.summary: A time gap in the data starts after this sample. The structure can be NULL in this case.

member.name: tagAM_SAMPLE_PROPERTY_FLAGS.AM_SAMPLE_FLUSH_ON_PAUSE
member.summary: For live data only; indicates discard in the paused state.

member.name: tagAM_SAMPLE_PROPERTY_FLAGS.AM_SAMPLE_ENDOFSTREAM
member.summary: End of stream occurs after this sample. This flag is reserved for kernel streaming. DirectShow currently does not use it.

member.name: tagAM_SAMPLE_PROPERTY_FLAGS.AM_STREAM_CONTROL
member.summary: Control stream identifier. A value greater than 0x7FFFFFFF indicates an application-defined stream.
